payload.name: arithmetic-intensity-predicts-compute-bound-vs-bandwidth-bound-regimes
payload.title: Arithmetic intensity predicts compute‑bound vs bandwidth‑bound regimes
payload.formal: (AI) is the slope of the bandwidth line in roofline. If your algorithm’s (AI) is low, adding more compute doesn’t help.
payload.apm2_mapping:
translate (AI) into *cognitive* and *governance* terms:

* **Data‑plane AI:** validation and hashing are memory bound; optimize for fewer passes and smaller payloads (13).
* **Control‑plane AI:** “verification work per byte of evidence” is what matters. Evidence must be compact but sufficient (92).
  If a gate requires fetching huge context, it is low “verification intensity” and will dominate budgets. This is exactly why APM2 pushes ContextPacks and content hashes: ship **references** not blobs.
